title: ASX soars 1pc; US-China trade deal sentiment lifts
text:
Robert Guy

Mortgage aggregator AFG says home loan activity rebounded strongly in the September quarter thanks to interest rate cuts.

The AFG Index showed a record $15.7 billion in lodgements in the quarter, with volumes up 21 per cent on the previous quarter and up 11 per cent on the same time last year.

More than 29,000 mortgages were lodged, the highest in two years.

The major banks continue to lose market share, with the non-major banks' share of the market climbing to 46 per cent - the highest level since the GFC.

First home buyers comprised 15 per cent of mortgages during the quarter, the highest level in seven years.
description: Australian shares are soaring through the morning trade; the US could revive a currency pact with China to suspend tariff increases next week.
